summit_speakers.name: Rasmus Dahlberg, he/him
summit_speakers.bio: Rasmus Dahlberg is a computer scientist and software engineer based in Karlstad, Sweden.  He has contributed to transparency log research and development since 2016.  Examples of recent contributions include his involvement in the Sigsum project and the C2SP community specifications related to witness cosigning.

talks.title: What is Sigsum and how can I use it for my application?
talks.abstract: [Sigsum](https://www.sigsum.org) is a free and open-source software project that makes a signer's key-usage transparent.  This talk introduces the design, which can be used as a building block to transparently publish executable binaries, reproducibility statements, KT tree heads, configuration files, and much more.
